RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNCONSCIOUS MIND engaged in close chase through the backstretch, contested even terms two deep midway on the turn, edged clear entering the stretch and was kept alert in the lane. LINDA'S TAJ set a pressured pace and contested the edge at the rail into the turn, was met midway through the turn, dropped back entering the lane and flattened stride late. AZTECA GIRL gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and ran evenly down the lane. STORMIN' ANNA pressured the pace inside, steadied into the turn then flattened stride at the rail. MELINOE chased outside, rounded the turn in the four path and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Linda's Taj
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge into turn,met rail mid turn,flatten late

ENTRY.NAME: Unconscious Mind
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase,even terms 2d mid turn,edged clear 1/8,kept alert

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 14200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 4, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since May 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUPER QUALITY took a quick lead and angled to the rail to rate the pace, was hand urged nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then steadily handled in the lane. HAPPY CHARLIE settled off the rail on the opening turn, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced in the three path on the far turn, closed for second mid-stretch and finished evenly. NEWS BOX rated close inside, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened nearing mid-stretch. ROCKY DICE stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole and flattened stride on the far turn. SLIPPIN JIMMY became edgy in the gate and steadied between horses early, rounded the first turn off the rail, angled to the outside entering the backstretch and showed little response. HAPPY CHAMP raced in the three path the first turn, left the turn toward the outside then saved ground on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Slippin Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: edgy gate,steadied between early,angled out 1/2,little response

ENTRY.NAME: Super Quality
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,rated pace inside,hand urged 5/16,rail turn,driving

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Terrazas Thoroughbreds, LLC, JasonLitt, SB Racing Corp. &

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Champ
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 4 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGGIE'S GIRL took an immediate lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was kept alert in the stretch. BARBERS POINT settled off the rail the opening turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, then dueled through the stretch for second. LUCKY BLONDE rounded the first turn off the rail, gave chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. JUBA'S PARADE settled off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and flattened in the lane. AIM'S JUBILEE angled to the four path into the first turn, left the turn outside and showed little response. JUBA BABY saved ground. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Maggie's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,rated pace,pressured 1/4,rail turn,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Baby
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MINEOLA MIKE rated a short lead inside, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept sharp through the stretch. PRESSURE settled inside on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and came along to take second nearing mid-stretch. RAGTIME RICHES stalked off the rail, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened passing the eighth pole. NORLANDER raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn. TAPADINE raced in the four path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase toward the three eighths pole but showed little response. Personal Finance became fractious in the gate and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Pressure
ENTRY.OWNER: Baccari Racing Stable LLC and Prince Chester

ENTRY.NAME: Mineola Mike
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured nearing 1/4,rail far turn,kept sharp

ENTRY.NAME: Ragtime Riches
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened past 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS ARGENTINA gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn, drifted leaving the turn but dug in under steady handling and got up later yards. RIGHT TO REFUSE gave chase toward the inside and raced at the rail on the turn, was steadily handled leaving the turn but gave up the lead in later yards. SHE'S A BRICKHOUSE chased the early pace toward the outside, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly to late stretch. MACHEN MARGARITAS set a pressured pace through the backstretch, bore out into the turn and flattened stride. BABY BREEZE broke a step slow, raced well back from contention and saved ground on the turn. PALACIO pressured the pace through the backstretch, was carried out into the turn and weakened. Per Stewards ruling #182, Miss Argentina has been disqualified from earnings.

ENTRY.NAME: She's a Brickhouse
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,off rail turn,evenly to late lane

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Miss Argentina
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,drifted 1/8,dug in,up & clear later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Right to Refuse
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,up rail mid turn,caught later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Machen Margaritas
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,bore out into turn,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER SINCE MAY 4, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since October 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOCIAL CHIC saved ground off the pace on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and improved in the four path on the far turn, dug in under determined handling leaving the turn and got up later yards. ALLEN CAN DO IT rated just off the pace inside then eased out leaving the first turn, started a three wide bid past the three eighths pole, took the lead four wide toward the quarter, was met leaving the turn but dug in gamely for second while outfinished for the win later yards. THEWITCHISGONE raced in the three path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and dueled to a brief slim lead in the three path leaving the far turn, but relented in the duel through the stretch. BUFF'S EYE VIEW steadied early and raced off the rail the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and bid toward the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn, moved to the outside entering the stretch and flattened late yards. COMMAND THE CAT stalked two deep on the first turn, closed to the lead approaching the three eighths pole but was met toward the quarter, continued close at the rail through the far turn but weakened into the lane. MARCHED rated the early pace off the rail, was met nearing the three eighths pole and gave chase from that point, but weakened at the rail on the far turn. RIVER CROSROAD RVF stalked three wide on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Allen Can Do It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Eastham Richard

ENTRY.NAME: Marched
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace off rail,met near 3/8,chased,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Buff's Eye View
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied early,eased out 1/2,bid 3/8,2d far turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Social Chic
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,4p far turn,determinedly,up later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: James and Eleanor Casey Memorial S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 95. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED FILLIES TWO YEAR OLDS. $50 nominations close Wednesday, October 25, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Wednesday, November 1, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies and all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: 121 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earn ings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIRECT THE CAT took over and moved to the inside past the thirteen sixteenths pole and rated the pace, put Mad Swann away nearing the three eighths pole, was hand urged to widen at the rail on the far turn then steadily handled in the lane. RUNAWAY BEAUTY saved ground off the pace, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, but ultimately, had to settle for second best. RAN OUT OF TRAINER bobbled at the break then saved ground, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and came along for third nearing mid-stretch. LONA LEE rounded the first turn off the rail, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. KRISTINACHRYSALIS raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. MAKANI rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase from the three path nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. MAD SWANN tapered in and stalked two deep on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, but dropped back toward the three eighths, faded from that point and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: Makani
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close 1st turn,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Direct the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,hand urged 5/16,widened rail turn,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 4 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DENALI D'ORO saved ground off the pace the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, came through the far turn in the four path, dueled for the lead mid-stretch and widened the final sixteenth. IHEARTRAINACOMN saved ground on the first turn then eased outward into the backstretch, bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced in the six path on the far turn, left the turn outside and came along to take second later yards. SPARKLEINYOUREYE rated close inside on the first turn, bid three wide approaching the three eighths pole, took the nod past the five sixteenths and contested the edge through the far turn, dueled at even terms in the upper stretch but was met a sixteenth away and flattened later yards. LA MADDALENA took over and moved to the inside to show the way, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met passing the five sixteenths, remained close at the rail on the far turn but weakened the final sixteenth. VERY VENUS stalked two deep the first turn, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole and raced close between horses on the far turn, but flattened stride mid-stretch. FRENCHIES GOLD stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path, angled in leaving the turn but showed little more. ABUNDANT STORY saved ground. UNUSUALLY LUCKY dwelled several lengths behind her opposition leaving the gate and could only save ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Iheartrainacomn
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out 1/2,bid 3/8,6p far turn,along 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Abundant Story
ENTRY.OWNER: Sharp Marc J and Lockhart Jeffrey A
